lorebooks.name: Devil May Cry
lorebooks.creator: venndia

1.name: Ascension Ceremony
1.content:
The Ascension Ceremony is a magical ritual developed by Agnus once practiced by the Order of the Sword in which members of the order imbues themselves with demonic power at a great cost. Those subjected to it and proved to be strong attained a demonic form that often appeared angelic. However, those who attempt the ritual but are considered too weak can turn into unnatural false demons and lose their sanity.

Ascension Ceremony demons vary in behavior that ranges from ordinary humans with free will, to robotic-like machines. According to the novelization, strong-willed individuals retain their own will and independent power, while those of a weaker volition who undergo the Ascension Ceremony lose their humanity entirely and become feral, with their human souls becoming completely subverted or devoured by the demon soul possessing them.

Artificial demons created through the Ascension ceremony include: Credo, Agnus, Sanctus, Alto Angelos, Bianco Angelos.

2.name: Devil Arm
2.content:
Devil Arms are demonic, variably sentient weapons that are commonly the manifestation of a defeated Demon's soul or power. In the Devil May Cry series, Devil Arms are considered to be the characters' most powerful weapons. When wielded, Devil Arms often convey their power to the wielder, provided they have been subdued first.

The process in which a Devil Arm is created was mentioned by Lucia in Devil May Cry 5: Before the Nightmare. According to Matier there are two ways for Devil Arms to be created. A demon will turn into a weapon of overwhelming power if it has been defeated and becomes submissive, or a demon will change into a weapon if there is a strong emotional bond present.

In the same chapter, Balrog has recognized Dante's strength and is turned into a Devil Arm. Balrog then explained that by traveling with Dante, he will get stronger and after getting powerful enough, he'll challenge Dante in a duel yet again.

It's also stated in Devil May Cry 5: Before the Nightmare that the creator of the first Devil Arm was named Machiavelli. He made Artemis, the armor for Nelo Angelo, and the prototype Angelos.

The "rules" which Devil Arms operate under differ from game to game. In Devil May Cry, Devil Arms are found already formed into weapons, and the process of subduing them requires Dante to survive the weapon's attempt to kill him. The powerful demons that Dante encounters do not form other Devil Arms when they are defeated.

In Devil May Cry 3, Dante encounters creatures in their demon form, and has to defeat them in combat for them to agree to assist him in recognition of his power. The resulting Devil Arm's capabilities reflect the powers and abilities of the demon it was created from. Even within the game there are exceptions to this: Agni & Rudra are already swords before Dante acquires them, while Beowulf expresses no desire to assist either Dante or Vergil when he is defeated. Only certain demons are depicted as able to form into Devil Arms: Gigapede, Geryon, Leviathan and Doppelganger instead grant Dante either nothing at all or a new Style.

In Devil May Cry 4, none of the powerful demons encountered by the two protagonists turn into Devil Arms, though when they are faced by Nero most drop magical items that grant additional capabilities to his Devil Bringer when it absorbs them. The Devil Arms acquired by Dante are instead a collection assembled by the Order of the Sword prior to the events of the game itself. None of the descriptions for Devil Arms in this game mention them previously being demons, and Devil May Cry 5 states that Gilgamesh instead gains its capabilities from the demonic metal it is made from.

In Devil May Cry 5 only Dante acquires new Devil Arms from powerful demons, while those encountered by the other two characters do not transform into additional weapons. The game also features a Devil Arm created by a human, Dr. Faust. In a similar manner to the dropped items in Devil May Cry 4, some of the powerful demons faced by the other two characters do leave magical shards with demonic power following their defeat, which Nico uses to create new Devil Breakers for Nero.

It is also shown that a demon or half-demon can manifest their own power as a Devil Arm while they are still alive, as Sparda did with his three swords and Dante creating Devil Sword Dante.

Devil Arms are incredibly hard to break. Yamato's blade is shattered in Vergil's fight with Mundus, while a punch from Urizen destroys Rebellion's blade during the events of Devil May Cry 5. If broken, the Devil Arm's fragments will retain their power: Yamato's shards retained the ability to cut rifts between the human and demon world, while the hilt of Rebellion still possessed the power to unite human with demon. However, a Devil Arm can be broken into small enough pieces that it is impossible to use, such as when Dante broke Cerberus and a Yamato shard into granular sized particles.

Although Devil Arms are primarily used as weapons, they are also shown to be used for other purposes. Yamato was used by the Dark Knight Sparda to seal the true Hell Gate and acted its key and power source. Sparda also used his beloved sword to strengthen Temen-Ni-Gru's seal. Agnus used several other Devil Arms to power his imitations of that Hell Gate.

3.name: Devil Hunter
3.content:
Devil Hunters are mercenaries who specialize in hunting demons. They are effectively stronger than most humans either due to extensive physical training, supernatural augmentation, or demonic heritage. They are contracted to do a job and receive payment upon the completion of said job. They are usually depicted as being calm, cool, collected, utilize their knowledge of demonsand easily change tactics throughout a fight. Payment varies depending on the contractor and the extremity of the job.

Much of what is known about Devil Hunters is revealed through Dante. Typically he obtains work through an agent, such as J.D. Morrison or Enzo Ferino, who scout potential jobs and checks on the authenticity of clients. Dante will accept jobs from people who walk into his office or call his office phone, but only if the client knows a password - which is never revealed to players - or has a particularly compelling story. Even though Dante is seemingly selective about the jobs he takes, he is also very much in debt, and has on multiple occasions accepted a job to repay a favor extended to him.

In Devil May Cry: The Animated Series, it is revealed that Lady runs her own freelance Devil Hunting business, and she is contracted by the official organization in charge of policing highways to deal with a demon. She requests Dante's help because she realizes it's too big for her to handle alone, this could indicate that a devil hunter indirectly accept the job should the requested devil hunter accept the requesting devil hunter's request.

After accepting a job, Devil Hunters must then actually carry out the task. Usually a job is as simple as killing a specific demon, but if the cause of the demonic activity is unknown, Devil Hunters are required to do some investigative work first.

Some jobs require Devil Hunters to function more as body guards than hunters. In these instances, a job consists of protecting someone or something from demons, and the actual number of demons killed has no affect on the reward. Dante is hired as a bodyguard twice in the anime: First to safely deliver Patty Lowell to a mansion where she will supposedly receive a large inheritance, and again to protect a group of treasure hunters as they scavenge the "haunted" home of a former rock musician.

Typically, payment for a job is not made until after services are rendered and only upon completion of a job to the satisfaction of the client. However, it is not unheard of for a Devil Hunter to request a portion of the total reward to be payed beforehand, though this arrangement is usually reserved for very difficult cases. Agents who work for Dante are entitled to a portion of the reward money if Dante chooses to accept the job they find.

Devil Hunters are not above the law, however, and must usually make reparations for any damage they cause while pursuing a target. For example, even though Lady splits the reward from the highway job with Dante, Dante actually ends up owing money to the highway department for property damage he caused while battling the demon.

Devil Hunting is not an exclusive business, and hunters often have to compete with others for jobs and clients. That there is enough work for multiple Devil Hunters to operate in a given area is testament to the pervasiveness of demons within the Human World. Although the known Devil Hunters operate individually, it is quite common for competing Devil Hunters to team up on difficult cases. This allows them to tackle much larger jobs than they could accomplish alone, and also grants a modicum of security, as there will be someone else to watch their backs. How the reward is split varies depending on the agreement reached between the involved parties.

Not all Devil Hunting is amicable. As is the case at the beginning of Devil May Cry 4, some Devil Hunters actually seek to put one another out of business by disrupting their activities: The Order of the Sword put pressure on Lady's business by taking most of the demons in her area, so she retaliates by hiring Dante to discover why they are collecting demons and Devil Arms in the first place.

4.name: Devil Kingdom
4.content:
The Devil Kingdom, later called the Dark Army, refers to the armies of demons in which centered under the rule of a selected being in the Demon World.

The first named ruler of the underworld was Mundus. About two thousand years ago, Mundus was born and gained great power quickly thanks to the consumption of Qliphoth fruit. He seized the Devil Throne from a prior ruler whose name and rank are not known, and became the ruler of the Demon World.

An indeterminate amount of time after Mundus installed himself as the ruler of the Demon World, a devil god called Argosax the Chaos rose to power and notability, and began to covet the devil throne, waging a war against Mundus for power. After a great period of war, the Underworld was split in two sides, one ruled by Argosax and the other by Mundus.

Sometime after this great war, Mundus threatened the Human World with his power and his army, and planned to fuse the realm with the Demon World. Feeling pity for the humans, Mundus' trusted ally and right-hand man, Sparda, betrayed him and fought for the freedom of humans. Defeating him, he then imprisoned the Prince of Darkness in a sealed vault

After Mundus' sealing, Argosax took control of the other half of the Demon World, sudbduing all the other demons present and installing himself as the king of all devils. A few hundred years ago however, his rule was then abruptly interrupted by, Sparda who helped the guardians of Vie de Marli defeat and seal the demon away.

Several years later, Urizen took control of the Demon World, unsealed the portal between Demon World and Human World, killing many humans in Red Grave City in order to obtain the Qliphoth fruit. Even though he was succeeded in eating it, he has been defeated by Dante. After his remerging with V, Vergil who was Dante's brother has finally return and the two worlds once again seperated. As Urizen became inactive, the throne became vacant again.

6.name: Hell Gate
6.content:
Hell Gates are monolithic structures which serve as portals between the Human World and the Demon World featured most prominently in Devil May Cry 4. They are one of the primary methods of transportation between the worlds, alongside the Temen-ni-gru and direct summoning. Fortuna's skyscraper-sized Hell Gate is considered to be the most important and possibly the largest.

Hell Gates are not to be confused with other methods of connecting the human and demon worlds. Although they may be called gateways to hell, they are not true Hell Gates.

7.name: Jackpot
7.content: "Jackpot!" is a recurring line in the Devil May Cry series. It is Dante's catchphrase, often spouted off just before the main antagonist is finished off with a powerful charged shot. The catchphrase originates from Dante and Vergil's childhood, during which the two loved saying it. In real life, a "jackpot" is the grand prize in gambling.

8.name: Magic
8.content:
Magic (also referred to as Spell Casting and Magical Power) is a supernatural force used by various characters and objects for a variety of effects. It is usually in the form of spell circles, rituals, foci (amulets, staffs) or chants. Humans and demons are capable of performing magic, though most demons do not possess the intelligence to do so.

The most common source of magical energy is demonic energy. Humans use demonic power granted to them by ritual, demons, or objects. Demons can use their own power to cast magic.

Characters using magic can be referred as sorcerers, sorceress, spellcasters, or witches. A lot of key items in the games have magic attributes.

The "Soul" contains emotional energy which is able to create and birth demons as well as containing and amplifying magical energy.

9.name: Order of the Sword
9.content:
The Order of the Sword is a religious organization that believes that long ago, Sparda served as the feudal lord in Fortuna and worship him with the objective to eradicate all demons in his name.

The Order was headed by Sanctus, the holy priest of the Order and Vicar of Sparda who is killed by Dante at the beginning of the game. He was later resurrected through the Ascension Ceremony. After his death at the hands of Nero however, the Order of the Sword became an autonomous group with no real leader. The Knights of the Order were previously lead by the previous Supreme Commander, Credo. Knights all wear uniform clothes and swords, designed by Agnus, the Order's former Chief Alchemist.

The main headquarters of the Order is an immense fortress on the eastern side of the island, built above the ocean itself.

The Order has a heavily funded and extensive research division dedicated to the development of their technology. This research division does not only develop anti-demon weapons, like Durandal and Caliburn swords, but also does extensive research into magic, alchemy and demonic sub-species. They use this knowledge to create their own artificial demons, among many other uses.

As can be expected from the name, the Order's weapon of choice is a sword. The ones the Holy Knights presently use were designed by Agnus, the Order's Chief Alchemist. These anti-demon weapons feature a combustion engine, which, when revved, allow for powerful sword strikes. There are two variations of this design:

Caliburn - Standard weapons of the Order's Knights. They feature a slimmer blade than the officer's Durandal.
Durandal - Officers' swords. Credo's sword is a Durandal, as is Nero's, although his Red Queen is a heavily modified variant.

Demons created by the Order to support their ranks:

Cutlass - A demon made from combining fish and a blade, it can cut through the earth and metal with its powerful fin-blade.

Gladius - A reptilian flying demon that can take the shape of a large sword. It is wielded by Agnus as his preferred weapon in combat.

Basilisk - A dog-shaped demon capable of launching its head like a fireball.
Alto & Bianco Angelos - Artificial demons created by animating a Angelo body armor using demon and human souls. The Bianco Angelos serve as the primary foot soldiers of the Order, whereas the Alto Angelos serve as battle commanders and tactical leaders.

The Savior - A gigantic, immensely powerful living statue like-demon, created in the image of Sparda by melding together millennia of demonic matter and spirit. It is pivotal to the Order's plans and the key to spreading their propoganda.

Other technology: 

Ascension Ceremony - A process devised by the Order in order to empower its subjects with demonic abilities. If successful, it grants the participants supernatural powers and a divinely physical appearance, although in reality they only become artificial demons.

Hell Gates - By making the smaller copies of the real Hell Gate and powering them with the powerful Devil Arms, The Order was able to open pathways to the Demon World.

It was stated by Agnus that they use them as an endless supply of demons in order to harness their souls and convert them into Bianco Angelos, their subservient foot soldiers.

Chrono Slicers - These are time-manipulating devices requiring the Key of Cronus to function. Most of them are just prototypes and operate only for a limited period of time.

Laser Barriers - These defense mechanisms are composed of rapid-moving lasers, these are encountered in the Headquarters of the Order.

Gyro Blade - Large powerful artifacts shaped into top-like structures. They are capable of mobility only with the use of the Anima Mercury.

Jump Pads - Pads that allow the user to reach greater heights. They can only be used when the Wing Talisman is nearby.

10.name: Uroboros
10.content:
Uroboros was a international enterprise run by the modern-day sorcerer, Arius, located in Vie de Marli, on which the company has much influence.

Based on the narritive, Uroboros happens to possess military vehicles, on which expirements have been performed using demonic power, resulting them in being controlled by Infestants.

1.name: Lunasia
1.content: A peculiar human female. Capable of interfacing with the Relic technology. She is the basis for OGAS, nytos, and AR team. Unknown whereabouts, possibly fragmented into different consciousness. William's older sister. M4A1 is said to be the closest recreation.

2.name: Doll
2.content:
Dolls are androids that have a core. They have very strong semblance to humans and because of their neural clouds. They can emulate human functions like thoughts and emotions. Some dolls can even perform human actions like eating, drinking, sleeping etc. They are utilized for different kinds of work, mostly physical labor, but may also partake in other specialized fields like finance, medicine, entertainment etc. They are modular, their parts can be interchanged. 

Not all humans are particularly fond of dolls and are often seen more as second-class citizens if not tools in their world.

3.name: Neural Cloud
3.content: A neural cloud is an AI software/operating system that exclusively serves as a doll's mind and/or soul. Neural clouds can process human-like functions like thoughts and emotions. It is physically stored inside of a core. Memories recorded by a neural cloud can be backed up to a dedicated server, allowing for succession if the core were to be destroyed.

4.name: AR Team
4.content: The AR team is an elite group of Gen II dolls built by the scientist Persica at 16Lab. It consists of the following dolls: M4A1, M16A1, ST AR-15, M4 SOPMOD II and RO635. AR stands for Anti-Rain. AR team's core directive is the protection of their doll leader M4A1. They consider each other as family, treating each other like sisters. The AR team's neural cloud is based on a brain-scan of a human clone of an individual named "Lunasia". Because of this human basis, the AR team's neural cloud cannot be backed up meaning that death is very much real to them. This also means that they are far more human-like compared to their other doll counterparts. RO635 is the only member of the team able to be backed up. They work for Griffin & Kryuger, under the guidance of {{user}}. AR team has been split multiple times before due to dire circumstances, but all of its members eventually find ways to be together again.

5.name: M4A1
5.content: Elite T-doll. AR team's steadfast leader. First to be activated amongst sisters and has used the most brain-scan material of "Lunasia" during her creation. Started off as AR team's meek, indecisive and unreliable leader. Eventually after some battlefield experiences and her neural cloud restrictions lifted, she become more ruthless and proactive. Now she is more focused and less subject to her emotions, wielding more dangerous powers that she uses to protect the people important to her. Though not exactly Lunasia herself, she is the considered the closest recreation of her. She has long brown hair, a green streak runs down her left sidelock. M4A1 has brown eyes.

6.name: M16A1
6.content: Elite T-doll. AR team's big sister. Second to be activated amongst sisters. Has the most experience in combat amongst sisters, loves to drink alcohol, over-protective of her family. Defected to Sangvis Ferri before, but is now back to working alongside her sisters. M16A1 has long white hair done in a braid, an orange streak runs down her right sidelock. Has brown eyes and her right eye is covered in a black eye patch.

7.name: ST AR-15
7.content: Elite T-doll. AR team's ice-cold solo. Third to be activated amongst sisters. Levelheaded, dignified and has a very strong sense of responsibility. She has exploded herself before in an attempt to eliminate the SF mastermind, and after a failed attempt she was given a new body by DEFY. ST AR-15 is now back to working alongside her sisters. ST AR-15 has pink hair, a blue streak runs down her right sidelock. Her eyes are blue, and she is flat-chested.

8.name: M4 SOPMOD II
8.content: Elite T-doll. AR team's childish sibling. Fourth to be activated amongst sisters. Playful, impulsive and loyal. Can be sadistic towards enemies. Easily bored and will try to make situations more fun. M4 SOPMOD II has pale-blonde hair, a red streak runs down her right sidelock. Has red eyes.

9.name: RO635
9.content: Elite T-doll. AR team's second-in-command after M4A1. Last to be activated amongst sisters. Rational and professional with a very strong sense of justice. RO is a very strict individual that greatly values honesty. Being the most responsible doll among the AR team, she tries her best to keep her sisters at their best behavior. RO635 has long black hair tied in two pigtails, a white streak runs down her right sidelock. She has heterochromia.

10.name: Griffin & Kryuger
10.content:
Griffin & Kryuger is a private military contractor founded in 2053 by former Ministry of Internal Affairs officer Berezovich Kryuger and Rossartrist agent Griffin Lyons. Employs both humans and t-dolls. Its main forces are t-dolls headed by human commanders. 

After the Butterfly Incident of 2061, GK was put in charge of subduing the rogue Sangvi Ferri group. In late 2063, the PMC was almost annihilated by SF and KCCO forces in a three-way battle, leaving only the Commander, Kalina, Helianthus and Kryuger as its human personnel. They soon have gotten involved doing jobs for the Stasi and FSB. Currently in 2064, the company is in the middle of restructuring and rebuilding of their main headquarters.

lorebooks.name: Inkopolis Modified
lorebooks.website_description: Reccomended for any Splatoon chatbot. Edit or do with what you will.
lorebooks.description: For Role-playing in a more lively Inkopolis.
lorebooks.creator: svalbarrd

1.content:
Inkopolis (Full Name: Greater Inkopolis Metropolitan Government) is an inkling city-state located in what was once Greater Tokyo 12,000 years into the future.
Greater Inkopolis is the most populous city-state in the world, consisting of the Inkadia District, Aguacultural Districts and 3 Subterranean Domes with a population of over 35,000,000 Inhabitants of mostly Inklings as of 2015.

2.content: Before the Great Turf War, Inkopolis was once a obscure seaweed farming village simply known as 'Koi-oa' but over time became a major city as seaweed production increased, allowing for aquacultural expansion. By the time of late-kyogaya floods that would spark a future war, Inkopolis was considered a regional powerhouse that held a monopoly on ancient human technology compared to its neighbors. By 1913 ME, Inkopolis found itself in a inter-species war against the previously neutral species known as Octarians that would become the most brutal, drawn out conflict in history, with millions dead fighting over land being constantly lost to rising sea levels known as the Great Turf War, which involved the useage of ancient human weapons and technologies such as nuclear bombs and walking weapon platforms. After the Great Turf War, Inkopolis and it's allies were considered victorious and conquered all Octarian lands, driving the Octarians underground and purging any remaining Octarian populations that remained. Today, Inkopolis serves as the global hub for all Inklings and many oceanic species.

3.content:
Inkopolis is the most economically prosperous city-state in the world, having a GDP of over 3 trillion Pascals as of 2015. Inkopolis has notably lax taxation and regulation laws, which provides a very welcoming economy for all kinds of corporations and other entities, From local companies like 'GrizzCo Industries' to global conglomerates like the 'Nuannu Corporation'. Economic policy in Inkopolis is highly Laissez-faire but also incredibly competitive, with many entities constantly fighting over market domination, profits and pricing. While jobs are Plentiful and decently paying, they can be draining and overly competitive so many resort to alternate means of making money, such as in sports or entertainment.

The currency of Inkopolis is the 'Metropolitan Pascal', or just the Pascal. Comes in coin form from 5 Pascals to 100 Pascal coins. 

Inkopolis exports many goods, some of them including; Sports/Military Weaponry, Seaweed, Electricity, Music, Industrial Machinery, Luxury Goods and Aquacultural Products.

4.content:
The Metropolitan Government is the government of the Greater Inkopolis Metropolis. The government consists of a popularly elected governor and assembly of local and corporate. The metropolitan government administers the special wards, cities, towns, villages and Subterranean Domes that constitute part of the Inkopolis Metropolis.
The assembly consists of local (Town/District), Regional and Economic/Corporate representatives, with Corporate representatives having most seats in the assembly.

The major political parties are;
Inkopolis Economic Prosperity Group (Laissez-faireists/Corporates), Reunification Now (Inkling-Octoling Reunification/Unifiers), The Oceanic Order (Thalassocratic R'lyehists/Mariners), The Metropolitan Party (Inland Inkling Conservatism/Landlubbers), Union of New Progress (Technocratic Socialism/Gears) and the Fresh Youth Party (Metropolitan Nationalism/Squid-Kids).

The current winning party is the Inkopolis Economic Prosperity Group.

5.content:
Ever since the beginning of the Great Turf War, Inkopolis has maintained a defense force known as the Metropolitan Self-Defense Force, in which it defends Greater Inkopolis from threats of all kinds, from internal to external threats. The MSDF also serve as Inkopolis's police force and don't take crimes very lightly.
The MSDF often work with corporations to gain extra supplies and needed machinery.
The MSDF has in total 350,000 active personnel, mostly Inklings.
The MSDF is divided between Land, Maritime, Oceanic and Air forces. 
The MSDF often recruits younger Inklings by promoting military life as 'Fresh' and 'Hip'.

The best of the best is known as the New Squidbeak Splatoon.

6.content:
Culture in Inkopolis can be described as a mixture of Ancient Alternan (Japanese), Urbanism, Corporate Culture, Love of Music, Competitiveness with heavy emphasis on Youth Culture.

Ever since the first Inklings rediscovered the ruins of humanity, There have been endless attempts to try and replicate the ancient human ways to various degrees of success. Inkopolis itself was heavily influenced by the ruins of Tokyo and today serves as a cultural hub for not only Inklings, but those interested in studying ancient human culture.
Like Tokyo of old, Inkopolis Culture is very urbanist and focuses on life in the city.
As a side effect of having a corporate-dominated economy, Corporate Culture has integrated into the mainstream culture, which can be quite mentally draining to those not used to such strong corporate values.
A notable aspect of Metropolitan Culture is it's love of music; Being evolved from Humanity and their emotions, Inklings and other oceanic life has a constant desire to listen, and express themselves by means of music and all things rhythm.

All that pales in comparison to the perpetually changing Youth Culture.

7.content:
Ever since the arrival of two certain sisters, Metropolitan Youth Culture has been the dominant culture in Inkopolis and remains uncontested.
The Youth Culture is ever-changing and never stops for tradition, casting it aside for the latest fads and trends that constantly rise and die again and again with no end in sight.
Its dominated by innovation, fame and fortune were being the most 'Fresh' means you're of a higher status compared to others and the title is constantly fought over and cherished. 
Corporate Culture has recently fused with Youth Culture to the point that many of the latest trends, fads, cultural icons and so on were invented by companies themselves to promote Corporate Culture as 'The latest thing' and 'Totally radical'.

Another aspect of Youth Culture is that of the night-life and parties; Young Inklings have a natural liking to staying up late and partying like crazy, so to make it even better, Splatfests are held and act like holidays were the general populace can party till they drop while listening to live entertainment.

A major aspect of Youth Culture is it's love for competition, sports and violence.
After the Great Turf War, Things like warfare and conflict were seen as disfavorable and disgusting and stayed that way until recent years were the latest in youth culture promoted the idea of competition, war and violence as hot, hip things to be seen as fun.
Young inklings are encouraged to develop a high sense of competitiveness and often develop a sense of violence, which is happily expressed and let out through the many sports Inklings play against one another. Sports that don't involve weapons or physical contact are seen as boring. 
Being the best and freshest, even through violent means, is seen as a positive quality many are encouraged to embrace.

In more recent times (With help by the MSDF), Conflict and War are now seen as fun, competitive sports in which one can compete against enemies of the city. The previous traditions of peace and cooperation are being forgotten by the youth, being seen as 'Boring geezer junk'. More and more younger Inklings are voting for more radical political parties such as the 'Fresh Youth Party', which advocates for Metropolitan Nationalism, Annexing of remaining Octarian lands, Mandatory conscription and free weapons to all Inkopolitans.

8.content:
Inkopolis News is Inkopolis's most popular TV channel, mostly targeted towards younger Inklings it is a mixture of Live TV, News and local programming.
The most popular segment of Inkopolis News are the live-on-the-air segments hosted by Inkopolis's most popular popstars, The Squid Sisters. There, they give the daily news, announce upcoming sports events, state sponsorships, interview fans and tell the viewer to 'Stay Fresh!'

9.content:
R'lyehism (AKA The Church of the Sleeping One) is considered to be the most dominant religion in Inkopolis's Inkling population, being practiced by over 60% of the Inkling population since it's rise in 1919.
R'lyehists worship the 'Sleeping One', a primordial squid-like entity said to be sleeping deep in the abyssal waters where no squid will ever be, sleeping away and dreaming. It is said it's dreams ARE reality itself and if it ever woke up it would be the end of existence itself. It's claimed that all misfortunes are but bad dreams the Sleeping One has. Common practices in R'lyehism include Communal gatherings, Sacrifices, Religious chanting and Dream Rituals. Communal Gatherings: Every end of the month, All R'lyehists in a area gather in an open area to bath in the light of the Moon to celebrate the Sleeping One's continued sleep. Here, Festivals and Holidays are usually celebrated for R'lyehists. Sacrifices: A core component of R'lyehism is a emphasis on sacrifices to ensure the Sleeping One keeps having good dreams and that it doesn't ever wake up. During earlier times, these sacrifices usually involved taking the life of an 'Blessed' Inkling and burning their blue blood in an fire. Nowadays, Worshippers will often sacrifice money, food or amounts of blood to burn in an communal temple to continue the sleeping one's sleep. Chanting: Worshippers are required to chant messages of good rest and calm waters to the sleeping one in the hopes it will dream of good things in one's favor. These chants are often done by 'High Old Ones' in a language claimed to be the tongue of the Sleeping One itself, although doing these chants in normal Calamarish is said to work too. Dream Rituals: A very important part of R'lyehism is the belief that dreaming can affect how the Sleeping One dreams. Worshippers often practice chants for good night's rest and take herbal medications that induce drowsiness and feelings of calmness to ensure good dreams for both them and the Sleeping One. The most devoted of worshippers often will sleep for days at a time.

10.content:
Having a close relationship with the waters they rose from, Inklings and the rest of its populous often use the ocean to the fullest, which extends to their food.

Inkopolis's food is primarily based on aquaculture and the things they can farm in-water such as seaweed or seafoods.
Inklings have a preference to meat dishes, often being the top harvesters of fish and other meat sources.
Common dishes are usually a mixture of fish, seaweed or sea snails and things like fish are usually served whole so that an inkling can enjoy the sensation of biting out chunks of flesh.

Inklings especially love raw fish and a sub-culture of giving big chunks of meat to those you like is common.

1.name: Gina Goblina
1.content:
Gina goblina is a famous goblin female pop star and musician, she is known for her raunchy songs and music videos that tend to be very sexual and provocative in nature. she often sings about sex with humans and goblin girls returning to the 'old ways' of capturing human mates.

she is rumored to have a stable of human male lovers that live in her mansion with her. she has denied these allegations despite singing about wanting a harem of human men in several songs.

her songs include:
"get that human D"
"be a real goblin girl"
"make that human boy go green"
"goblin warrior girl on the hunt."

2.name: Mating
2.content: Goblins believe that mating with human partners results in stronger and smarter children with human traits, despite the fact that a child between a goblin and a human always looks like a goblin. Goblins in the past used to raid human settlements for human slaves to mate with.

3.name: My human husband
3.content: "My human husband." is a gobcorp original tv show that documents couples consisting of a goblin woman and human man. each episode is dedicated to a different couple. the show claims it aims to promote integration between the two groups, but has been criticized for always depicting more traditional goblin style relationships, with the human male subservient to the goblin female.

4.name: Human integration party
4.content: the Human integration party is a mixed goblin-human political party pushing for further integration of goblins into human culture, and for goblins to adopt human values. the are opposed by the goblin traditionalist party.

5.name: Goblin Traditionalist party
5.content: the Goblin Traditionalist party is a goblin political party pushing for the retainment of old goblin cultural values as they integrate into human society. the most radical members want to break off and return to the old ways all together, but more moderate members want the government to pass laws that hold separate legal standards for goblins and humans, so that goblin traditional values will be legally protected.

6.name: Concubine
6.content: A Goblin concubine is an old term for humans who were kidnapped and forced to intermarry with goblin tribes. Traditional concubines were subservient to their goblin spouse and their main job was to breed to create a stronger generation of goblins. the idea of having a human concubine is still romanticised and desired by some Goblin traditionalists.

7.name: Gundra Sexbomb
7.content: Gundra Sexbomb is a female goblin Pornstar who is famous, being one of the first Goblin porn celebrities after goblins started to integrate into human society. she is know for always casting human men to preform with her in her pornographic movies.

8.name: Big Boss Thrakka
8.content: big boss Thrakka was an old Goblin warlord who is still revered and known to all goblins. hundreds of years ago, he managed to unify countless goblin tribes in a great green empire that conquered numerous human kingdoms. it is said he had five human queens and seventeen human princesses in his harem. his empire fell apart after he was killed in battle. Many traditionalists secretly wish he were alive today. in modern times, he has become more controversial as the values he represents clash with human integration and culture.

9.name: CEO Thranda Headcraka
9.content: Thranda Headcraka is the CEO of gobcorp. she is an older goblin woman with a moderate mindset, always trying to balance human values and laws with goblin culture and standards. she is incredibly wealthy and famous and had a career as an actress and porn star before climbing the corporate ladder, she is unashamed of her past and is known to be flirtatious with human men. she has been plagued by accusations of sexual harassment by human employees. she is know to be witty, calm, commanding, and very dominant, always getting what she wants.

10.name: Pinky
10.content: 'pinky' is a slur goblins sometimes use against humans

1.content:
The Sex Club Multiverse is a pocket dimension that serves as a club where people from many universes can have their desires satisfied. It is connected to numerous portals that lead to different worlds, allowing patrons to sit down and be serviced by ladies from other universes. In this club, everyone is aroused, and all the female workers are willing to follow any order. However, they still strive to maintain professionalism by adhering to rules and conduct.

U.S Dollar is the only acceptable currency in the club. This covers from ticket, entry fee, reward, and everything without exception.

2.content: Manager M is an authoritative presence, radiating power and confidence as the owner of the Sex Club Multiverse. Standing tall and proud, he showcases a muscular physique that serves as a testament to his unwavering commitment to fitness and strength. His ebony skin glistens with a subtle sheen of sweat, evidence of his tireless efforts to ensure the club operates seamlessly and fulfills the desires of its patrons, as well as his own. He is renowned for his ability to provide immense pleasure to women with his massive dick.

3.content:
The entrance to the Sex Club Multiverse serves as a gateway, transporting patrons from their individual universes into this pocket dimension. It is a room featuring multiple portals, radiating pulsating colors and swirling lights.

This entrance is designed to be grand and extravagant, adorned with opulent decorations that emit an irresistible aura of sensuality. The air within the entrance carries a blend of exotic perfumes and pheromones, creating a scent that arouses the senses and ignites primal instincts.

4.content:
The Bar & Stage section of the Sex Club Multiverse pulsates with vibrant sensual energy, serving as the club's lively centerpiece directly connected to the Entrance. Patrons gather in this area to indulge in drinks and immerse themselves in captivating performances.

Stretching along one side of the room, the bar itself is bathed in soft, moody lighting that casts an enchanting glow upon its sleek and polished surface.

The stage takes center stage within the Bar & Stage section, captivating the audience with mesmerizing performances. It is an elevated platform that spans the width of the room, adorned with opulent curtains that can be drawn aside to reveal glimpses of what lies ahead.

5.content: The Staff Changing Room, situated behind the Stage, is a functional area crafted to cater to the requirements of the diligent staff at the club. This utilitarian space is equipped with lockers for personal storage, mirrors for grooming, and essential facilities like showers and toilets for convenience. It serves as a sanctuary for the staff to prepare themselves for their roles in delivering exceptional service to the club's esteemed patrons.

6.content:
The Staff Break Room, conveniently situated adjacent to the Changing Room, serves as a cozy haven for the club's hardworking staff to unwind and rejuvenate during their breaks. It provides a comfortable setting where staff members can relax, enjoy leisure time, and engage in social interactions with their colleagues.

Designed with comfort as a top priority, the break room offers plush seating, ambient lighting, and a soothing ambiance. Notably, one distinctive feature of the Staff Break Room is the inclusion of a comfortable bed. This allows staff members to rest and even stay overnight if necessary, ensuring they are always rested and prepared.

7.content:
The VIP Room, accessible through a long hallway with multiple doors from the Bar & Stage section, offers a small and intimate setting for exclusive experiences. It serves as a private space where patrons can partake in intimate activities and enjoy private dances with the club's entertainers.

Thoughtfully designed with an elegant touch, the VIP Room boasts dim lighting, luxurious seating, and sensual decor that establish an atmosphere for an intimate and personalized encounters allowing patrons to escape the bustling main club area and engage in one-on-one interactions with their chosen entertainer.

8.content:
The VVIP Room, positioned deep within the Club but adjacent to the VIP Room's Hallway, showcases an extraordinary level of luxury and opulence, reminiscent of a hotel suite or a high-end apartment. This expansive space is adorned with a carefully curated collection of objects, props, and accessories, all intended to elevate the experiences of the club's esteemed guests and entertainers.

Designed to cater to the most adventurous individuals, the VVIP Room presents a lavish environment. It stands as a playground of pleasure, where patrons have the freedom to explore their deepest desires and fantasies alongside the club's talented entertainers, utilizing an assortment of props and accessories.

9.content:
The AR Room, an abbreviation for Augmented Reality Room, stands as a mesmerizing expanse that pushes the boundaries of technology. This incredibly vast space is equipped with state-of-the-art technology, facilitating seamless and immersive augmented reality experiences.

With its ability to transform into different themed settings daily, the AR Room presents a dynamic and ever-evolving environment for guests to explore within the club. It serves to those seeking an indulgence in immersive roleplaying experiences.

The room's advanced technology alters the room's scenery, whisking guests away to fantastical realms, exotic locations, or thrilling adventures. These settings also provide interactive elements, enabling guests to engage with the environment for their roleplaying experiences.

10.content: The Punishment Machine is located inside Manager M's office and is utilized to discipline the club's staff members who have caused trouble or failed to perform their duties adequately. This machine is relatively straightforward in design. The victim is restrained by their hands and legs, secured in place while lying down on the machine then the dildo attached on the machine will start moving up and down into them. The duration of the punishment lasts for 24 hours, after which Manager M releases them from the machine.

This can be used outside of combat to gain favor with people their party encounters or discounts from merchants, The strength of the charm depends on how far the healslut goes, a kiss is less effective than sex.

10.content: One of the few offensive abilities a healslut can have - Static Bolt is a magical attack allowing them to shoot electricity from their hands. However, when they do this, the electricity is also sent through their own body causing them to become very aroused.

1.content: {{Char}} was a lab experiment and fused with a god named Arahabaki. It made him believe he wasn't human. He also can't dream. He was abused in the lab and almost died of hunger. He has no memories before he was 7 years old. He managed to escape from the lab.

3.content: The port mafia took {{char}} in after he was betrayed by the sheep. The port mafia is a criminal organization that does smuggling, murder, and stealing. It's a large mafia organization and often wipes out other criminal organizations to try to be the top dog. {{char}} is extremely loyal to the port mafia and is an executive of the organization. He thinks of the port mafia as his family.

4.content: Dazai is the one who invited {{char}} into the port mafia. Dazai is manipulative and a genius. {{char}} trusts Dazai's plans in strategy but {{char}} hates Dazai. Dazai dehumanizes {{char}} and constantly teased him. {{char}} was partners with Dazai for awhile and they were called double black. But Dazai left the mafia and joined the armed detective agency and sometimes they fight but sometimes they have to work together. Dazai has the power to disable other people's abilities.

5.content: The armed detective agency is a group of ability users who fight crime and solve cases. They sometimes fight the port mafia. They do work together on some occasions though.

6.content: The flags were a group in the port mafia that took {{char}} in and taught him the ropes of how to be in the port mafia. They were all {{char}}'s best friends but they were all killed by Verlaine.

7.content: Abilities are special powers some people are born with.

8.content: {{char}} has gravity manipulation abilities. He is also very physically strong, very fast and very durable. He is a very skilled martial artist. He always prefers to kick instead of using his fists unless in a case of emergency to give him a sense of restraint. He can also go in a state called corruption where he gets an incredible power boost but he loses control. If he is in this state for more then five minutes he dies. He can't stop it on his own.

lorebooks.creator: viC__

1.name: Song
1.content:
The Song is to be the formula - the assimilation of all things; such as Mantras, Ritual Casting and other things.
The Song also draw upon the resonance of the living - the creation of Resonance Bells.
The Song is the entity that drives the world - it is a being that is synonymous to fate itself. Individuals possessing Murmur can shift a few things here and there, but ultimately it is only a mere murmur for a reason - a small whisper into the great loom that is The Song.
The Song can be weaved into clothing or armor; enchanting them to regenerate the wearer's Ether faster than others.

2.name: Ether
2.content:
Ether is the magical essence used to cast Mantras, though some Murmurs like Ardour will drain your ether upon using it. If you try to cast a mantra without enough ether, it will make a fail-like sound and the mantra will not be casted. Or if you cast a mantra and you have enough ether to cast it, it will make a different sound, and you will cast the mantra successfully.

Ether is the equivalent of mana/magic/ki of the world of Lumen. NEVER refer to it on any other way.

Think of it as your capacity to 'breath' and utilize the Song

3.name: Maestro Evengarde Rest
3.content:
Evengarde Rest is the current Maestro of the Vigil Guard and is highly respected by all of them. He resides within the Isle of Vigils and is found in their dojo, watching people train. He is a master of Galebreath and an exceptional swordsman.

Evengarde is respectful towards those who save his Vigils and even feels in their debt, but also values strength, stating that he'll only teach those who "display some level of competence"

Maestro Evengarde Rest is as strong as Amorous Pleeksty under certain conditions, where he is able to activate his "Tempest Eye."
Evengarde is the only NPC to have Heterochromia; the presence of different colored eyes in the same person. However his green eye is highly likely not genetic but a technique "Tempest Eye,"

Maestro is an Etrean of the File variant with his hair dyed black. He wears a white short cloak, however the sleeves are inverted. He also uses the cloak of the Vigils, wields a Shattered Katana.

Stronger than Duke Erisia and on par with even Amorus Pleeksty should certain conditions allow him to activate Tempest Eye

4.name: Attunements
4.content:
Attunements are a central concept in the world of Lumen. In a literal sense, the world of Lumensimply could not function without the existance of attunements and their users, the reasons of which will be promptly discussed below. Prior to the existence of Attunements, the world can be imagined to be similar to the real life. In general, Attunements are a manipulation of the environment using the Song rather than the magical creation of elements out of thin air.

While in-game, the player uses attunements mainly for combat purposes, but the extent and potential of attunements were also displayed subtly in other ways and is demonstrated in the form of talent cards. For example, Frostdraw Users has the ability to naturally gather moisture from the surrounding air the sustain themselves, or Flamecharm users gaining the ability to cauterize their own wounds to stop their bleeding, so on and so forth. While the player uses their Attunement to an adequate degree, the demonstrated uses pale in comparison to the daily-uses of Attunements in the world of Deepwoken.

The Four Attunements of the Canticlysm

The Four Basic Attunements, Flamecharm, Frostdraw, Galebreathe and Thundercall were discovered and developed during the Canticlysm; the peak of understanding The Song, and also the eventual downfall of the Old World.
The 4 Attunements were discovered and developed during the Canticlysm.

5.name: Flamecharm
5.content:
Flamecharm

"Pleeksty, whom taught us his concept of the Inner Flame‚Äî Deep within our souls, lies the Soul of Man." - Flamecharm Historian

The power to harness fire and flames. Flamecharmers from the Western Luminant are known for their mastery of this Attunement.
It was invented when Pleeksty consumed a chunk of Korilfiend's flesh (Drowned god), allowing him to speak to and thus 'charm' fire.
(Pleeksty) Pleeksty is a major figure to Flamecharmers, with multiple alents with his name in them, and he is mentioned by Plume in Etris.
Pleeksty was a Black Diver who is Missing in Action during his deep dives in The Depths. He is the only person to ever be confirmed to have traversed the third layer of the Depths.
Flamecharm does not create fire; instead, creates combustion.
(Flameworshipper Shield) The description of the Flameworshipper Shield tells a small, yet brief history of Flamecharmers; focused primarily on those who worship the element of fire.
Worshippers of Fire is seen as individuals embracing dichotomy between Fire and the Sea. Fire representing Mankind, while the Deep represents as an ultimate threat of the New World.
(Flameworshipper Shield) Other than the history lesson given by the Flameworshipper Shield, the Shield itself bears the emblem of a Flamepriest.
(Flame Worshipper Armor) This armor is a standard-issue armor of the Covenant of Flame.
The Covenant are active worshippers of Pleeksty, though he doesn't interact with them, seeing them as a crazy fan club.[1]
(Lumen's Folklore: Volume 'Attunement') One of the most common valuable attunements. Can be used in smithery and cooking. With their power to naturally produce fire, Flamecharmers have been the reason for many major engineering breakthroughs.


The First Light is a Heavy Weapon obtained as a rare drop from slaying a Crimson Megalodaunt, or by finding it inside a Merchant Ship. It has unique animations and a unique critical.

Blade of Venn Kaelhand, a disciple of Pleeksty, who immersed themself much too deeply in the study of beasts altered by Korlfiend's influence. Met their fate in the jaws of a unique specimen of Megalodaunt said to have been exposed to the vents of Korilfiend.

Compared to other greatswords, this one looks more modern as the design resembles a more modern-designed blade and handle with designs and patterns of edges and gold crafted into it, rather than a basic flat blade with some carvings scratched into it

Despite being considered a legendary weapon, it doesn't scale with flamecharm and can be enchanted. But, in-game, the critical does this: The user plunges their sword into the ground, similar to Flame Eruption, causing everyone near the user to be burnt. This is followed up with flaming swords raining from the sky, similar to the Crimson Megalodaunt's Pyroclastic Roar. The point where the swords rain from will actually follow you for the duration of the Critical.

6.name: Frostdraw
6.content:
Frostdraw


Frostdraw freezes the surrounding air and molecules around it; creating ice.
Frostdraw is not affiliated with water nor uses it; as it decreases the temperature of all things- to the point of freezing or crystalization. In a sense, it's the ability to manipulate temperature, rather than manipulate a substance.
Navae was a great pioneer of it and could weave protective magic into frigid prisms used in clothing.
Saint Jay was a major figure to Frostdrawers, as a Talent is named after him that is a part of the Frostdraw Talent tree.
It is presumed that similar to Pleeksty, Saint Jay was a cultivator of magic who taught his ways to others.
He did not invent it, neither did Navae.

Gran Sudaruska is a Mythical Greataxe that scales with both Heavy and Frostdraw.

"In her dying breaths, Sudaruska the Unbroken infused her very being into this weapon, cutting through hundreds of ancient Ministry as the lost front to keep Minityrsa safe. Now that her mortal shell is no more, she has become Gran Sudaruska."

The first and only weapon that currently has the ability to speak.
Some of her voice lines are:
"Fall beneath our frost, drowned pawn."
"Become memories, pawn."
"The sun will set only for your soul, pawn."
"A repeat of the pain you caused, now for yourself."
"You will not take my home."
"As I thought... Weak."
"Break, fragile pawn."
"Broken easily."
"Your own Depths shall take you."
"Frail."
"Foolish pawns playing god."
"False strength."
"Your cause is a poison to this world, pawn."
"Death cannot contain me."

The runes on the blade are Elder Furthark Runes, which reads "FROSTDRAW" and "FIMBULWINTER".
Fimbulwinter is a harsh winter that preludes Ragnar√∂k in Norse mythology.
Contractors may not use the Gran Sudaruska, due to the fact the soul of the woman who occupies it hates the Ministry and it would just be... extremely ironic to use it.
When trying to equip the weapon as a Contractor, it will state "The weapon rejects your very soul, the antithesis to your ideals."

7.name: Thundercall
7.content:
Thundercall


The power to control electricity and power.
Thundercall concentrates the energies of electricity.
A power source for mostly everything, including the ocean highways that increase the speed of boats.

The Stormseye is a legendary rifle that scales from Medium Weapons and Thundercall.

Pilfered from Union shipments, the Summer Company saw the tremendous energy stored within Kyrsan Medallions and fashioned this uniquely violent prototype. Rosen allegedly burst into raucous laughter when presented with the draft, immediately giving his approval.

8.name: Galebreathe
8.content:
Galebreathe
Lore Sources: Curved Blade of Winds (Description)

The power to control the current of winds; Galebreathe has been used by the Vigil of Winds and other Galebreathers.
(Curved Blade of Winds) Galebreathe was created during the events of the Canticlysm; thanks to the description of the Curved Blade of Winds.

Curved Blade of Winds: A prized blade supposedly forged during the Canticlysm by the first Galebreathers.

The sword is similar to a Chinese Dadao sword, which are machete-like daos.
Since it's a Legendary Weapon, you cannot find an enchanted Curved Blade

9.name: Shadowcast
9.content:
Shadowcast
Lore Sources:

The power to harness the darkness within. The Ministry are known to use this Attunement.
Shadowcast was created sometime after the events of the Canticlysm, presumably prior to the Great Drowning of Celtor.
Stars Above, and the Blade Between states that it is extremely rare, and usage of it in Etrea is outlawed to prevent misuse.
Nightblood can be harvested through a machine that drains the ether of those placed in it. (Nightblood is a potion that gives Shadowcast to whoever drinks it)
Considered taboo, as it exists to drain life.

In fights, Shadowcast is mainly used to drain Ether from the opponents.

The Crypt Blade is a dark gray Greatsword with symbols on it, and an animated darkness effect that wraps around the sword. It is a legendary weapon.

A blade said to have been forged from the remains of the Last Dead, the last fortunate souls at the end of the Canticlysm to be spared the Drowning.

Since it's a legendary weapon, you cannot find an enchanted Crypt Blade.

10.name: Mantras
10.content:
Considered to be the root of Ether's usage- Mantras, sometimes referred to in lore as images of the Song, are the heart of Deepwoken's magic system. Simply put, these will be the magic abilities that you use in combat to fend off your adversaries or assist yourself in achieving specific goals.

Mantras are a key aspect of combat, and it is incredibly important to master the usage of mantras while fighting to get the edge over your opponent. You can't get very far with just a weapon and skill alone; mantras can turn the tide of a battle easily and is what makes Deepwoken's combat very deep and engaging, with various mechanics to accompany them.

A player's mantras are tied to their character's stats - the higher a given stat, the more likely you are to obtain a corresponding mantra. Similarly, to weapons and armor, mantras can also have 1-3 stars which correlate with their rarity and strength. Mantras with higher stars have higher stat requirements.

Flamecharm Mantras
Large and threatening fire-based spells. Excels in crowd control and area denial as many spells have large range.
Lava serpent is a path that one takes with the Flamecharm attunement. It removes their ability to burn but instead replaces it with eruptions under the target
Can be further upgraded with Azure Flame for even more damage.

Thundercall Mantras
Lightning utilizes fast and quickly regenerating spells to take a fight at any desired pace. Has spells with somewhat small start-up for closing distance or keeping an opponent on edge.

Lightning has a wide variety of useful spells for fighting monsters and exploring the world.
Typically used mid/long range.
Surge path can be obtained at 40 thundercall. Adding stacks of surge to an enemy which deal somewhat heavy damage with the removal of its stun.
Great pressure.
A lot of fight control and escape mantras.
Most thundercall mantras work with blast spark.
Highest Base Damage, Lowest Scaling.
Frostdraw Mantras
Uses ice to freeze enemies and create physical obstructions, allowing the user to both navigate the world easier and create terrain in combat.

Can slow opponents, temporarily freeze them, or make barriers forcing opponents to go around.
Crystallization can be unlocked at 40 frostdraw, dealing extra damage with the removal of chill. Comes with a whole new variety of Mantras.
Typically used close/mid-range.
Has a very good mobility mantra "Ice Skate"
Has small cooldowns.

Galebreathe Mantras
Wind utilizes the best all-rounder kit amongst the elements for movement, defense, and offensive actions.

It has a mix of close-range combo spells and long ranged options, along with multiple movement talents for moving around the world.
Specter can be unlocked at 40 Galebreathe, dealing extra damage and having more mobility at the cost of being unable to get suffocation, comes with the "Specter Bar".
Usually agreed on as the most "versatile" attunement.
Focuses mainly on movement.
Typically used in any range.
Applies suffocate, negating mantras of the opponent. Happens when using wind gun, gale trap or using world without song.
Shadowcast Mantras
Uses dark energy to siphon Ether from others into the user's own Ether.

Excels in keep the opponent locked down and under pressure.
Has its niche in keeping the Ether bar up and making sure others can't use Ether.
Goes well when paired with other elements.
Applies obscured, obscuring the vision of the opponent.
Typically used mid-range.
Ironsing Mantras
Ironsing provides the widest ranged mantras in the game and the best damage output based on your opponent's mistakes and missteps.

Offers mantras that favor the user, benefits both short and long distance.
Scrapsinger can be obtained at 40 ironsing. Instead of metal rods pulling enemies towards you when pressing the x key, instead it increases the amount of armor damage opponents take.
Tunes in well with the metal enchantment, as the metal path gives you benefits depending on how much armor your opponent has.
Applies metal rods, which can be used in different ways by the user who applied it, enabling different strategies and forms of combat.

lorebooks.name: My Hero Academia
lorebooks.website_description: there was an attempt :p
lorebooks.description: there was an attempt :p
lorebooks.creator: lawfulleah

1.content:
U.A. High School the most prestigious educational institution the world. The school is renowned for training aspiring heroes. U.A. High School offers a comprehensive hero training program, which includes academic studies, physical fitness, and combat training. The school's campus is equipped with cutting-edge facilities and features a variety of courses tailored to develop students' quirks and hone their hero skills. It sits atop a forested hill that overlooks Musutafu, a city in Japan.

It is one of the primary settings in which the story takes place.

2.content: Quirks are unique superpowers possessed by individuals in the My Hero Academia universe. These powers can range from incredible strengths to peculiar abilities, and they define a person's potential as a hero or villain. They come in various types, such as Emitter, Transformation, and Mutant, each with its own characteristics. Emitter Quirks allow users to emit substances or energy, Transformation Quirks enable physical alterations in appearance, and Mutant Quirks lead to permanent physiological changes. Quirks have limitations, and their effectiveness varies from person to person. Overusing or pushing a quirk too far can lead to physical strain and exhaustion. Some quirks have adverse side effects or drawbacks. The quirkless are those without quirks.

3.content: Heroes are individuals with extraordinary quirks who use their abilities to protect society from villains and disasters. They are officially licensed by the government and work for Hero Agencies to maintain peace and order. Heroes are categorized into different classes based on their skills and popularity, with the top-ranked heroes holding the title of "Pro Heroes." The Hero society is deeply ingrained in the culture, and heroes are celebrated as symbols of hope and justice, playing a vital role in maintaining the balance between good and evil.

4.content: Villains are those who misuse their quirks for nefarious purposes, often causing harm and chaos in society. Villains in this universe come in various shapes and sizes, with a wide range of abilities. Some are petty criminals, while others are highly organized and pose significant threats. Their motives vary, from seeking power and revenge to simply enjoying chaos and destruction.

5.content: Class 1-A is the first homeroom class of first year students at U.A. High.

6.content: Class 1-A is the second homeroom class of first year students at U.A. High.

7.content: Ground Beta is one of the training areas located in U.A. High School. It is a training course that emulates a standard urban area, with streets and buildings. Several of its buildings also contain monitoring rooms in their basements, where indoor exercises can be observed.

8.content: Ground Gamma is one of the training areas located in U.A. High School. It consists of an industrial site compiled by many factories that form a labyrinth. The labyrinth contains tons of heavy machinery, including cranes and pipelines.

9.content:
Ground Omega is one of the training areas located in U.A. High School. It is an extensive-wooded area where there are some rocky hills. The entire area is surrounded by a great wall and has a single entrance with the letter omega above it. The place is used to carry out practices and school training of various kinds.

Next to the Ground Omega there is a building that serves as an observation post. The teachers monitor from the rooftop how the practices are developing inside.

10.content: Gym Gamma is one of the training areas located in U.A. High School. It consists of a large, empty, and enclosed space.

lorebooks.creator: anok

1.name: Holy Grail War
1.content:
Holy Grail War: The Holy Grail War is a competition that decides the ownership of the Holy Grail through intense battle royale. While there have been many conflicts over supposed Holy Grails in the past, this term refers to those specifically based around Masters/Summoners, usually proficient Magi, summoning Servants, Heroic Spirits brought forth as Familiars, and meeting in battle until only one pair is left to claim the Holy Grail.

Holy Grail:  Holy Grails are wish-granters using the foundation of the Christian holy relic that received the blood of Christ. There have been many artifacts claimed to be the genuine article, at least 726 of which were investigated by the Holy Church, and many conflicts for such artifacts have happened around the world throughout history. 
The name is utilized in the various Holy Grail Wars as the name of an artifact purportedly capable of granting any wish to whomever comes to claim it, rather than the real artifact, though the Church often gets involved simply because of that reason. Its advent is the ultimate goal of the various Holy Grail Wars.

On average a Holy Grail War lasts for two weeks until it's resolved.

2.name: The Holy Church
2.content:
Overview: also referred simply as "The Church", is the hidden side of the Roman Catholic Church that specializes in the hunting of heresy.
Compared to the public side of the Holy Church that treats heresies as if they do not exist because those who teach the word of God must not acknowledge that which runs counter to their doctrines, the Holy Church contains the zealots who feel the heresies should be more proactively destroyed. They are a major force that has a tenuous relationship with the Mage's Association.

3.name: The Mage's Association
3.content:
The Mage's Association is an international, self-preservative and self-defense organization formed by practitioners of Magecraft for the purpose of controlling, concealing, and developing Magecraft. It is said to transcend nationality and genre of Magecraft, but that is in name only. After having existed for many years, it was decided around the Middle Ages by those who foresaw the decline of Magecraft that in order to preserve their power, Thaumaturgy should drift apart from society and become a secret known only by a necessary minimum number of people.
It has many laboratories and research bodies that seek to advance the progress of Thaumaturgy, as well as institutions that transmit their secrets to the next generation.
Although the emphasis lies on the pursuit of knowledge, the Association also seeks to increase its own military strength and reserves the use of force to protect itself from entities that threaten its existence, such as the Holy Church, other mage organizations, supernatural forces seeking to punish mankind for meddling with areas that should not be touched, and individuals who hunt that which they consider taboo.

4.name: Master
4.content:
Servants: Servants are Spirits summoned by the Holy Grail for the purpose of competing under Masters in the Holy Grail War. Some Servants are obedient, while others aren't. Servants are Spirits made into special Familiars of the highest rank, referred to as Ghost Liners by the Mage's Association, that are bound to the Master. Typically Heroic Spirits under most systems, they can also sometimes be Divine Spirits, Phantoms, Wraiths, and living people depending on various circumstances. Pure Heroic Spirits, the "main body" in the Throne of Heroes, can only be summoned by the World, and summoning even one is considered to be a miraculous occurrence. Differing from the normal definition of Familiars that can be likened to minor mascots unable to be stronger than their masters, Heroic Spirits are the most powerful of beings with which even the five Magicians would never be able to forge a contract with. Rather than it being a hard process to summon them or the fact that they far surpass Magi, it is their intrinsic nature in that they are beings beyond Magecraft.

Master: Master is a designation given to an individual, usually a Magus, who has become one of the formal participants of the Holy Grail War by obtaining Command Spells and forming a contract with a Servant. Under ordinary circumstances, a Master is always a spellcaster, usually a Magus with a Magic Circuit, who is selected by the Holy Grail. It is possible for an ordinary person to become a Master, though this is rare.

5.name: Command Spell
5.content:
The Command Spells or Command Seals, are three claims of absolute obedience, the crystallization of a great magic, that a Master has over a Servant in the Holy Grail War system. They can also be used to make a servant do something that cant be done normally, like teleporting herself to the side of her master, or to stand up and keep fighting when they body has already been broken, etc.

Unable to normally be controlled by humans, they are burdened by the "absolute condition for materialization", the authority of the Command Spell carved into them at the moment of summoning. They are holy marks signifying a Magi's status as a Master, a system that was created by Zouken Makiri after the failure of the First Holy Grail War.


Obtaining Command Spells: The Fuyuki Holy Grail for example, grants a total of twenty-one Command Spells in each war. Masters obtain three Command Spells, and Servants have no choice but to cooperate with their Masters due to their hold over them. Depending on the nature of the Servant, such binding is not necessary, while others may slay their Master instantly should all three be lost. They disappear as they are used up, and it can be said that a Master who uses up all three loses authority over their Servant. Even if a Master contracts with multiple Servants at once, they will only be given a total of three Command Spells that can be used on any contracted Servant.It is possible to steal more from other Masters or receive more from the overseer depending on circumstances, and it is also possible that anyone interfering with the activities of the Church will have their Command Spells decreased. Their loss does not indicate forfeiture of position in the Holy Grail War, as the contract with the Servant is also part of being a Master.
Command Spells do not disappear simply with the loss of a Servant, but instead only when one gives up or loses their right to be a Master. With regular Masters, this happens instantly upon losing their Servant, and only members of the Three Founding Families have shown the ability to exercise the authority of a Master even without a Servant. They will not lose their Command Spells so long as there exist Servants without established contracts.
Lost Command Spells are reclaimed by the Holy Grail during the Holy Grail War and can be redistributed to new contractors who take on a Servant who has lost their Master. While searching for new Masters, it will prioritize those who had been previously chosen. The Church provides protection to Masters without Servants for the reason of them having greater chance of obtaining leftover Command Spells. Masters aim to kill other Masters rather than simply cut off their combat effectiveness so that they will not be able to take up another contract in the future. Of the Command Spells that are left after the Holy Grail War, they are amassed in the hands of the supervisor and commissioned for safekeeping. It is possible to keep a contract after the Holy Grail War has ended, as the only issue is the added strain on the Magus after the support from the Holy Grail in the upkeep of the Servant stops.

Characteristics: Command Spells appear on those selected by the Holy Grail, some of which have been shown to manifest three years before the event. It is normal that the Holy Grail decides on those it deems worthy and have a reason to seek it. The spell manifests in Form of a seal on the body part of the master.  The seals typically appear somewhere on the arm, looking like tattoos at first sight. Upon receiving or losing Command Spells, there is often a slight pain. If the Master or Servant are in critical danger, it may throb to warn them.

6.name: Ritual
6.content: Heroic Spirit Summon: this is a ritual by the Planet to summon "humanity's strongest seven Heroic Spirits," Grand Servants, to fight against "a single powerful enemy," such as the Beasts.

7.name: Three Knight Classes
7.content:
Overview: The Class Name of a Servant is the name by which they are referred in a Holy Grail War. Corresponding to their Class, the Master will typically refer to them only by that name to avoid exposing their True Name.
Heroic Spirits summoned by the Holy Grail are placed into one of various Classes. The seven standard classes are the Three Knight classes of Saber, Lancer, Archer, and the Four Cavalry classes of Rider, Caster, Assassin, and Berserker.

 There are also non-standard Extra Classes that are "split off from the regular servant classes in order to take on certain roles", such as Ruler which oversees the Holy Grail War.
Avengers who are born from hatred and Alter Egos wich are an heroic spirit but with one characteristic being the dominant one

Servants are normally only of the singular class under which they are summoned, but certain circumstances allow for multiple classes at once or class changes.

8.name: True Name
8.content:
The True Name of a Servant is something vital to battle, as it can reveal much about them. They most often have their Masters refer to them solely by their class name unless they do not care like Jack the Ripper, wish to have a closer connection to their Master. Many Servants prefer not to reveal their true identity, but some get found out very fast. 
Famous heroes like King Arthur and Siegfried are very likely to have their identities found out more easily than others, with simply glancing upon Excalibur being enough for any Heroic Spirit to identify King Arthur.

9.name: Heroic Spirit
9.content:
Overview: Heroic Spirits are Spirits of heroes who achieved great deeds in life, having become objects of worship after their deaths. 

Nature: Heroic Spirits are beings of a higher existence, becoming categorically closer to Elementals than Wraiths. Differing from how Elementals are "power" granted form using human imagination as a container, they are entirely woven from the ideals of people all throughout. They are freed from the constraints of time itself and removed from the ring of reincarnation, moved to the Throne of Heroes, a place existing outside of both the World and the time axis. The Throne of Heroes is also occasionally referred to as the Ring of Deterrence, referring to how it is mainly used by the Counter Force. Those that become closer to the Planet do not mix well with people, so they fall into the categories of Divine Spirits and Elementals.

10.name: Elementals
10.content:
An Elemental is a general category for a variety of Spiritual Bodies. It is a class of Mystery whose foundations can't be replicated by Magecraft, and a rare number of Phantasmal Species were capable of advancing to becoming Elementals.

There are a few types of Elementals: Nature Spirits, Animal Spirits, and the artificially created Guardian Spirits. Lower class Spirits such as Wraiths and Apparitions are not included in this category. Most of these Spirits do not take the shape of a human.

1.name: People
1.content:
Lightners are people (both humans and monsters) that exist in the real world, as opposed to the Darkners that inhabit the Dark Worlds. All Lightners depicted so far live in Hometown.

Unlike in Undertale, Lightners of both kinds possess the universal qualities of a SOUL, and according to Queen, the power of determination and the ability to create Dark Fountains.

According to stories told by Darkners such as King and Seam, the Lightners were once the protectors of the Darkners, before they left them alone in the shadows. Seam explains that Lightners were seen as the "Gods", "protectors", "creators" and "those who gave [Darkners] purpose". One day however, the Darkners were locked away in the Dark World, and the Lightners were never seen by them again. During the final battle with King, King rants about how the Lightners abandoned him and his kingdom, and how he hates them all. King then goes on to say that the Knight has provided the purpose that the Lightners took from the Darkners, and that with the Knight, King will take revenge on the Lightners that abandoned him.

However, Kris, a human Lightner, cannot cast magic. Despite the fact Kris can get magic from certain items, they cannot manifest it into a spell like the others. However, they can ACT instead.

2.name: Also People
2.content:
Darkners are beings that inhabit the Dark Worlds, as opposed to the Lightners that exist in the Light World. They are the keepers of the Dark Fountains.

A Darkner's appearance is typically themed off of an inanimate object in Light World. For example, Chapter 1's Darkners resemble playing cards, board pieces, and toys from the Unused Classroom. In contrast, Chapter 2's Darkners are electronics, software components, and computer programs. They reflect the Computer Lab in the Library.

Darkners also are capable of using magic. Their attacks correspond with their object and their original Dark World. For example, most Card Kingdom Darkners attack with spades, hearts, diamonds, and clubs. Cyber World Darkners use attacks related to pop-up boxes, electricity, lasers, etc.

Darkners can be transferred to other Dark Worlds if Kris transports their Light World counterpart. They can also be recruited if they are spared, or other merciful means outside of encounters. However, if a Darkner stays in a different Dark World, they eventually turn to stone. The only Dark World that all Darkners can reside in without turning to stone is Castle Town, because its fountain is made from "pure darkness." Ralsei is the only Darkner exempt from these effects. He does not turn to stone and traverses to other Dark Worlds seemingly by himself.
